news.title: Taoiseach Micheál Martin to bow to pressure on fielding Fianna Fáil presidential candidate
news.summary: Taoiseach Micheál Martin could have a Fianna Fáil presidential candidate on the pitch in the next 10 days, as pressure builds within his party to outline his plans.

news.title: Israel calls up 60,000 reservists as first stage in Gaza City takeover begins
news.summary: Israel’s military announced the first steps of an operation to take over Gaza City yesterday and called up tens of thousands of reservists while the government considered a new ceasefire proposal to pause nearly two years of war.

news.title: ‘My sister was a little corner of heaven and Mam was an amazing woman’ – singer Honor Heffernan in safety plea after carbon monoxide double tragedy
news.summary: Jazz singer and actor Honor Heffernan has urged people to be aware of so-called silent killers in their homes after statistics showed chimneys, flues, hot ashes and soot were the top causes of fires last year.

news.title: Daniel McDonnell: Azores is a fitting stage for Shamrock Rovers’ attempt to navigate uncharted territory
news.summary: For Irish clubs, tales of legendary away days in Europe traditionally revolve around trips to the east. Shamrock Rovers have gone in another direction this week in their attempt to create another piece of history.

news.title: Oliver Callan: Based on recent history, there is a surefire way to win our ‘best-paid, do-nothing job’
news.summary: The president of Ireland is such an inconsequential role these days that the hardest bit must be deciding what to spend your €600,000 salary and expenses a year on. It is the hardest job to win, but the easiest to do.

news.title: Entrepreneur Illann Power takes legal challenge against prosecution for revenue and forgery offences
news.summary: An entrepreneur awaiting trial accused of almost 90 revenue, forgery and reckless filing of company information offences has initiated a legal challenge against his prosecution.

news.title: Pierce Brosnan and Ben Kingsley on The Thursday Murder Club: ‘We came across this metaphor for our working relationship: Laurel & Hardy’
news.summary: It’s safe to say that fans of  The Thursday Murder Club , the hyper-successful cosy crime phenomenon, are an exacting and protective bunch. Anticipation for Netflix’s film adaptation of Richard Osman’s novel, directed by Chris Columbus and produced by Stephen Spielberg, has been running fairly high prior to release.

news.title: The best shows in RTÉ’s autumn line-up, from ‘The Traitors Ireland’ to Marian Keyes’ ‘The Walsh Sisters’
news.summary: There’s no doubt that the jewel in RTÉ’s autumn-spring season is  The Traitors Ireland,  which kicks off on RTÉ One on Sunday, August 31, with two episodes airing every Tuesday and Thursday.

news.title: Restaurant review: ‘I’m glad people who want to eat plant-based, gluten-free food have a place to call their own. I just wish the food had more flavour’
news.summary: A friend has been newly diagnosed with coeliac disease and her experience of eating out has so far been hit-and-miss. Sometimes, even though she’s told the restaurant she isCoeliac and has ordered dishes she has been assured are gluten-free, she has suffered symptoms, which suggests there has been cross-contamination. Most of the time, she tells me, the options are so limited, she wonders if it is worth going to restaurants at all

news.title: The Irish Independent’s view: Leaving Cert results shape futures – but don’t define them
news.summary: Since the first students took their Leaving Cert in 1924, results have been awaited with dread and excited anticipation.
